bibl.title: Despatch from Beverly Y. Payne to Edwin F. Uhl, February 20, 1894
Despatches from United States Consuls in Monrovia, 1852-1906

div1.p: Consulate-General of the United States, Monrovia, Liberia, February 20, 1894.
Mr. Beverly Y. Payne, to the Department of State.
Consulate-General of the United States, Monrovia, Liberia, February 20, 1894.
Honorable Edwin F. Uhl, Assistant Secretary of State, Washington, D. C.
Sir: I have the honor most respectfully to request of you the following supplies for use at this Legation and Consulate General.

1 American Ensign 12 ft length. 1 Small Consular Seal for wax on Consular envelopes. Stationary for official use, copying enclosures, and miscelleaneasou correspondence. Forms for Reports, Numbers 117, 159, 90, 101 or 102, & 113. General Quarterly account. Rent miscelleneaous account. Abstract of Contingent Expenses, and vouchers for rent.
I have the honor to be, sir: your obedient servant,
Beverly Y. Payne U. S. Vice Consul
